Heading"/> </w:LatentStyles></xml><![endif]--><!-- [if gte mso 10]><style> /* Style Definitions */ table.MsoNormalTable	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;	mso-style-noshow:yes;	mso-style-priority:99;	mso-style-qformat:yes;	mso-style-parent:"";	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;	mso-para-margin:0in;	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;	font-size:11.0pt;	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";	mso-ascii-font-family:Calibri;	mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";	mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;	mso-hansi-font-family:Calibri;	mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";	mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-bidi;}</style><![endif]--></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">The Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.15pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Order 1, Rule 10 of the Code of Civil Procedure read with section 57 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003 praying for adding them as party in the above suit stating that the properties describes in schedule Kha (1) of both the suits were mortgaged with the petitioner on 12.08.1997 by a registered deed of mortgaged dated 12.08.1997 accompa­nied by a registered power of attorney and also by deposit of original title deeds and that schedule Kha (2) of Artha Rin Suit No. 03 of 2006. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">The City Bank Limited vs. Judge, Artha Rin Adalat, Barisal (Md. Tafazzul Islam J) (Civil) 6 ADC 563</span></em></p><p class="Style6" style="margin-top: .1in; text-align: justify; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span class="FontStyle11"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;">Section 32</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.15pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></em></p><p class="Style3" style="margin-top: 1.9pt; line-height: normal; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span class="FontStyle13"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;">If a third party raises any objection</span></span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">J)(Civil) 8 ADC 649</span></em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> against the execution proceeding by submitting any claim ('vex), then he has to comply with the provision of sub-sec­tion (2) of section 32 of the Ain. What is important to note here is that the objec­tion must be against the execution of a decree and that the claim must be on the subject matter of the suit/execution pro­ceeding. <em>Md. Salim Hossain vs. Artha Rin Adalat (Syed Mahmud Hossain J) (Civil) 10 ADC 420</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 43</span></strong></p><p class="Style3" style="margin-top: .5pt; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: -1.0pt;">We</span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> have considered the submissions of the learned Advocate, the impugned judgment and the materials on record. This Division came to a finding that an application filed for setting aside the auction sale under section 57 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003 after dis­posal of an application filed earlier under Order 21 Rule 90 of the Code of Civil Procedure on 25.08.2005 was not maintainable. This Division also found that the application filed under section 57 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003 was also not maintainable because the judgment-debtor earlier filed another application under Order 21 Rule 90 read with section 57 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003 for setting aside the auction sale unsuccessfully.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Md. Mansur Rahman vs. Abdul Mannan Sarder (Syed Mahmud Hossain <span style="letter-spacing: 1.5pt;">J)</span>(Civil) 10 ADC 309</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Section 60(3) and 47</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right: 4.1pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 1.7pt 4.1pt .0001pt 0in;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Since a discretion/option has been given by the legislature to the plaintiff-bank to apply the provisions of section 47 of the Ain, 2003 even before its coming into operation in respect of the suit filed under the Ain, 1990 we do not see any bar on the part of the bank to exclude the amount claimed by it in the suit over 200% of the actual amount of loan dis­bursed by it to the appellant. And if so advised, the appellant may apply to the plaintiff-bank for deducting the amount claimed by it over 200% of the actual amount of loan availed of by him by ap­plying the discretion given to it by sec­tion 47 of the Ain, 2003. <em>Humayun Hossain Khan vs. Government of Bangladesh (Md. Abdul Wahhab Miah <span style="letter-spacing: 1.5pt;">J)</span> (Civil) 10 ADC 318</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.05pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Section 33(5)and 57</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Mr. Abdul Quiyum, learned counsel for <strong><span style="mso-font-width: 20%;">i </span></strong>the petitioners has taken us all the doc- <strong><span style="mso-font-width: 20%;">j </span></strong>uments and judgments including the im- | pugncd judgment and submits that the <strong><span style="mso-font-width: 20%;">i </span></strong>High Court Division erred in law in fail- <strong><span style="mso-font-width: 20%;">i </span></strong>ing to consider that the mortgaged prop­erty was collusively transferred by <strong><span style="mso-font-width: 20%;">i </span></strong>suppression of material facts by evicting the petitioners from their dwelling houses which property is quite distinct from the property mortgaged with the Rupali Bank. <em>Md. Rafiqul Islam vs. Md. Azmal Hossain (S.K. Sinha J)(Civil) 9 ADC .</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 3.85pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Section 57</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 1.9pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">From the facts as discussed, herein­above, it appears that the petitioners' first application for setting aside the auction sale held on 06.09.2006 was filed within time by making the statu­tory deposit to the tune of TK. 14,17,500.00, but because of mis­calculation there was a shortfall of TK. 1/76,114 which they already de­posited by filing application on 28.01.2009 along with the other deposit and thus, there was due and substantial compliance of the provisions of Order XXI, rule 89 of the Code after disposal of Writ Petition No.3326 of 2007, but the executing Court refused to accept the same on the view that the shortfall was deposited after long 2(two) years from the date of auction sale. Moreover, it appears that in the schedule of the property sold in auction the fact of exis­tence of a two storied house was also omitted which is a material omission. <em>Md. Shajahan vs. Secretary, represented by the Ministry <span style="letter-spacing: 1.5pt;">of</span> Law (Md. Abdul Wah­hab Miah <span style="letter-spacing: 1.5pt;">J)</span> (Civil) 8 ADC 685</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.5pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Section 33(5)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="Style3" style="line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif';">Certificate under section 33(5) of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain 2003 due to non availability of bidder in the auction sale held on 4.4.2005 for sale of the proper­ties mortgaged by the judgment debtor</span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> petitioners as security for the loan. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">M/s. Cromvege Tannaries Ltd vs. Joint Dis­trict Judge (Md. Tafazzid Islam J) (Civil) 6 ADC 594</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.75pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 47</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">There is no scope to argue that a plaint of Artha Rin Suit even if not filed along with the affidavit and the advalorem court fee as mentioned in sub-section (2) of section 6 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain,2003 can be registered as a Artha Rin Suit. The very language of sub-sec­tion (2) of section 6 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003, in our opinion, makes it mandatory that a plaint of a Artha Rin Suit has to be filed along with adval­orem court fee. Specially where the question of applicability of section 47 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003 comes the provision of sub-section (2) of section 6 has to be followed strictly. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">M.A. Bari Talukder vs. Agrani Bank (Nazmun Ara Sultana J) (Civil) 8 ADC</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right: 1.45pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">424</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.75pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Artha Rin Adalat Ain 2003</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.4pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Whether the Artha Rin Adalat can draw up a final decree beyond the statutory period of three years from the date of preliminary decree. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Rupali Bank Ltd. vs. M/s. Brick Linkers Ltd (S.K. Sinha J) (Civil) 8 ADC 523</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.15pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.4pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 12</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Challenged the legality of the notice fu auction sale of the properties of the pc titioners.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Under the provisions of Sub-section 8 of Section 12 of the Artho Rin Adalat Ain, 2003, such sale can not be ques­tioned. <em>Mrs. Zinnatul Ara vs. Govern­ment of the People's (A.B.M. Khairul Hague J)(Civil) 7ADC 901</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.75pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 49(3)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.9pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Auction purchaser, a third party, is di­rected against the judgment and order</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; tab-stops: dotted 2.45in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">arising out of Artha Jari Case</span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"><span style="mso-tab-count: 1 dotted;">..... </span><span style="letter-spacing: .5pt;">(1)</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">There is no scope for the High Court Di­vision to pass any order of stay of the order of the executing Court without finding any illegality in the procedure and the manner of selling the mortgaged property in auction, the High Court Di­vision fell an error in allowing the judg­ment-debtor to pay the dccrectal amount by installments in failing to consider that the property had already been sold in auction to the appellant and thereby he had acquired a valuable right in the, said property, which right could not be taken away without affording him an opportunity of being heard. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Farid Uddin Mahmud vs. Md. Saidur Rahman (S.K. Sinha J)(Civil) 8 ADC 196</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 12</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">petitioners as security for the loan. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">M/s. Cromvege Tannaries Ltd vs. Joint Dis­trict Judge (Md. Tafazzul Islam J) (Civil) 6 ADC 594</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 47</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right: .95pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 2.65pt .95pt .0001pt 0in;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">There is no scope to argue that a plaint of Artha Rin Suit even if not filed along with the affidavit and the advalorem court fee as mentioned in sub-section (2) of section 6 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain,2003 can be registered as a Artha Rin Suit. The very language of sub-sec­tion (2) of section 6 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003, in our opinion, makes it mandatory that a plaint of a Artha Rin Suit has to be filed along with adval­orem court fee. Specially where the question of applicability of section 47 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003 comes the provision of sub-section (2) of section 6 has to be followed strictly. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">M.A. Bari Talukder vs. Agrani Bank (Nazmun Ara Sultana J) (Civil) 8 ADC</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right: 1.7pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">424</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.75pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Artha Rin Adalat Ain 2003</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Whether the Artha Rin Adalat can draw up a final decree beyond the statutory period of three years from the date of preliminary deeree. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Rupali Bank Ltd. vs. M/s. Brick Linkers Ltd (S.K. Sinha J) (Civil) 8 ADC 523</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 1.7pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section </span></strong><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: 1.5pt;">12</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.9pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Challenged the legality of the notiee fo auction sale of the properties of the pe titioners. Under the provisions of Sub-section 8of Section 12 of the Artho Rin </span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Adalat<br/>Ain, 2003, such sale can </span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">not be quesoned. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Mrs. Zinnatul Ara vs. Govern-ment of (he People's (A.B.M. KhairulHaque J)(Civil) 7 ADC</span></em><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;">, </span></em><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">90 J</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.75pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 49(3)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 2.65pt 2.65pt .0001pt 0in;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Auction purchaser, a third party, is di­rected against the judgment and order</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; tab-stops: dotted 2.45in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">arising out of Artha Jari Case</span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"><span style="mso-tab-count: 1 dotted;">..... </span><span style="letter-spacing: .5pt;">(1)</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">There is no scope for the High Court Di­vision to pass any order of stay of the order of the executing Court without finding any illegality in the procedure and the manner of selling the mortgaged property in auction, the High Court Di­vision fell an error in allowing the judg­ment-debtor to pay the dccrectal amount by installments in failing to consider that the property had already been sold in auction to the appellant and thereby he had acquired a valuable right in the, said property, which right could not be taken away without affording him an opportunity of being heard. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Farid Uddin Mahmud vs. Md. Saidur Rahman (S.K. Sinha J) (Civil) 8 ADC 196</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right: 1.2pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">The petitioners mortgaged their proper­ties in favour of National Bank of Pak­istan, Agrabad Branch in order to secure the loan obtained by him. On his failure to repay, the bank published a notice in the newspapers to sell the properties mortgaged in its favour by auction on. This notice has been challenged in the writ-petition. <em>M. A. Hossain vs. Na­tional Bank ofPakista (A.B.M. Khairul Haque J) (Civil) 7 ADC 695</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.3pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Section 34, (9)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Under Section 34 of the Ain with a Bayer for warrant of arrest for civil jail igainst judgment debtor No.2 allegedly for not appearing in the court despite having notice of the execution case. <em>Abdur Rashid vs. Judge, Artha Rin Adalal No.l, Chittagong (Md. Abdul Matin J) (Civil) 7 ADC ' 611</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.5pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Section 33(1)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Challenging the legality of the auction notice published under Section 12(3) </span><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">lead </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">with Section 33( 1) of the Artho Rin Adalat Ain,2003, on the ground that the me frame of 15 (fifteen) days as stipu-etcd in Section 33(1) had not been omplied with. <em>Md. Rafiqul Islam fanique vs. Government of Bangladesh [A.B.M. Khairul Haque J) (Civil) 8 ADC 439</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 1.2pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Section 18, 9</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right: 1.7pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="Style3" style="line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; margin: 2.65pt 1.7pt .0001pt 0in;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Praying for a preliminary decree for Tk.78,70,728/- as on 31.10.94 with in­terest in­terest @ 20% per annum including penal interest and also praying that in case of the failure of the defendant peti­tioner to pay the decrectal dues, to make the decree final and direct sale of mort­gaged properties and also to pass a per­sonal decree against the defendant petitioner in respect of the shortfall amount after sale of mortgaged proper­ties. <em>Md. Nurul Hoque Sarker vs. Janata Bank(Md. Tafazzul Islam J) (Civil)6 ADC 142</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Sections 12 and 33</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Discharging the Rule arising out of Auction proceeding published in the Daily Jhanakantha on 25.04.2008 by writ respondent No.4 for selling the property of the petitioner. <em>Md. Nurul Abedin vs. Bangladesh represented by the Secretary (Md. Abdul Matin J) (Civil) 7ADC 301</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Section-60(6)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.9pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Plaintiff instituted Title Suit for realiza­tion of Tk.2, 52,268.50 only as on by selling the mortgaged property owned by the defendant the present petitioner. <em>National Board of Revenue represented vs. Dulal Chandra Bhoumik (Md. Abdul Matin J) (Civil) 7 ADC 548</em></span></p><p class="Style5" style="margin-top: 11.3pt; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">     </span><span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"> </span></span><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 57</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Complying with the provisions of the •Artha Rin Adalat Ain, <strong>2003, </strong>and under direction of the Executing Court an auc­tion-sale notice for sale of the mort­gaged property was published in two daily newspapers and the judgment debtor-petitioner hereof entered appear­ance in the execution case on <strong>08.08.2005 </strong>and prayed for adjournment of the sale with a plea of compromise and that the Executing Court allowed time fixing <strong>11.08.2005 </strong>for filing com­promise petition but the judgment debtor-petitioner did not file the re­quired compromise and hence the Exe­cuting Court fixed <strong>18.08.2005 </strong>for auction and on that date the auction pur­chaser-respondent No. <strong>1 </strong>hereof partici­pated in the bid and his bid, being highest, was accepted. Accordingly he deposited <strong>25% </strong>of the bid money on that date and subsequently deposited the bal­ance of the bid money. Thereafter the auction sale was made final. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Md. Mansur Rahman vs. Abdul Mannan Sardar (Shah Abu Naveem Mominur Rahman J) (Civil) 7 ADC 623</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 57</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section <strong>57 </strong>of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain,<strong>2003 </strong>for dismissal of the Execution<br/>Case</span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"><span style="mso-tab-count: 1 dotted;">...... </span><strong><span style="letter-spacing: .5pt;">(2) <span style="background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;">Bangla Type</span> </span></strong><em>K.M. Muzahid Islam vs. Bangladesh, Secretary Min­istry of Law (Shah Abu Nayeem Mominur Rahman J)(Civil) 6 ADC 865</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 4.8pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 5(4), 33(5), 57</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Artha Jari Case Petitioners under sec­tion <strong>57 </strong>of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, <strong>2003 </strong>read with section <strong>151 </strong>of the Code of Civil Procedure. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Sonali Bank, Sadarghat Corporate Branch vs. Mrs. Ilazera Islam (Md. Abdul Matin <span style="letter-spacing: 2.0pt;">J) </span>(Civil) 6 ADC 975</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Against the order of issuance of warrant of arrest dated <strong>25.08.2005 </strong>passed by the Joint District Judge and Additional Artha Rin Adalat No<strong>.2, </strong>Dhaka (respondent No. <strong>1) </strong>in Money Execution Case No.<strong>28 </strong>of <strong>2002 </strong>discharging the Rule. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; Abdul Aziz J) (Civil) 6 ADC 935</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.5pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 47(3)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="Style3" style="line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Challenging section <strong>47(3) </strong>of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003 (Act </span><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">VII </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">of 2003) as well as the proceedings of Artha Rin SuitNo.315 of 2004. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Irshad Hossain vs. Bangladesh represented by the Secre­tary (Md. Joynul Abedin J) (Civil) 6 ADC 82</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 4.55pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Section 33(7)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: .2in; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">The defence case is that under small in­dustrial loan BISIC on 18.05.1994 by sanction letter </span><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">No.</span></strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">94/04 the defendant received Tk.3,92,500/- and the defen­dant petitioner<span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">  </span>adjusted the loan of Tk.72,303/- but the plaintiff bank fraud­ulently created over draft loan (OD) of Tk. 1,65,546/- and when it was detected the plaintiffs authority was offered as loan of Tk.30,00,000/- (thirty lacs) on condition<span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">     </span>that<span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">     </span>the<span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">     </span>loan of </span><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">I </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Tk. 16,55,546/- will be adjusted and to </span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">I <span style="letter-spacing: .5pt;">return rest amount to the petitioner and I sanction the same in favour of the de-Ifendant petitioner for which the pet­itioner executed collateral security of |Tk.33,50,000/- in favour of the plaintiff bank. But the plaintiff did not ultimately materialize the plaintiff bank with ill motive kept petitioner's document in his Custody and suppressed the facts and filed the instant suit. </span><em>Dr. S. M. Eunus Ali | Joint District Judge and Artha Rin Malat (Md. Abdul Matin J)(Civil) 7 </em>be <em>194</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 4.55pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Section 33</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></p><p class="Style7" style="margin-top: .25pt; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span class="FontStyle15"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;">The judgment debtors for recovery of a sum of Tk.2,09,59,112/-. There was publication notice for selling of the mortgaged property on auction on 18th February, 2003 and ultimately 12th March, 2003 was fixed for sale of the mortgaged property. As no bidder at­tended in the auction sale on successive three dates on 12th March, 30th March and 14th June, 2003, the decree holder came up with a application that it had amicably settled the dispute regarding payment of the decreetal amount with the judgment debtor and prayed for staying further proceedings of the exe­cuting case. </span></span><span class="FontStyle16"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif';">Lt. Col. M. A. Man nan (Retd.) vs. Social Investment Bank Ltd (S.K. Sinha J)(Civil) 8 ADC 518, </span></span></p><p class="Style7" style="margin-top: .25pt; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span class="FontStyle16"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif';"> </span></span></p><p class="Style7" style="margin-top: .25pt; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 32(1)</span></strong></p><p class="Style7" style="margin-top: .25pt; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></p><p class="Style7" style="margin-top: .25pt;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">The Rupali bank Limited instituted Artha Rin Mortgage Suit No.69 of 2003 in the Court of the Artha Rin Adalat, Narayan-gonj, for realization of a sum of Taka 18,37,494/- with interest against the re­spondent Nos.3-6 stating that on the basis of the application of the judgment debtors, the plaintiff bank initially sanc­tioned a sum of Taka 1,50,000/- as cash credit hypo loan on 12th August, 1991. <em>Jalaluddin Ahmed vs. Md. Selim Hossain (S.K. Sinha J)(Civil) 7 ADC 291</em></span></p><p class="Style8" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 32 (2)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></p><p class="Style3" style="line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">The respondent No. 1 Sonali Bank Lim</span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif';"> <span class="FontStyle13"><span style="mso-ansi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt;">ited instituted Artha Rin Suit No.623 of 2004 in Artha Rin Adalat No.l, Dhaka against the respondent Nos.2 to 5 for re­alization of outstanding loan. The said suit was decreed ex-parte by the judg­ment and decree dated 08.09.2004. </span></span><span class="FontStyle12"><span style="mso-ansi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt;">Md. Humayun Kabir vs. Sonali Bank (Naz-mun Ara Sultana J) (Civil) 9 ADC 335</span></span></span></p><p class="Style7" style="margin-top: .5pt; line-height: normal; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span class="FontStyle14"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif';">Section 13(1)</span></span></p><p class="Style6" style="text-align: justify; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: .5pt;"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"> </span></span><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;">Section 28, 29, 49</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Sections 28 and 29 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003 for dismissing the Ex­ecution Case on the ground of limita­tion.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: .5pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">M/S M.M. Steel &amp; Limited vs. The Judge, First Artha Rin Adalat (Shah Abu Nayeem Mominur Rahman <span style="letter-spacing: 1.5pt;">J) </span>(Civil 875</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 4.55pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Section 28</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.9pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">After taking three adjournments on the 4th date on 22.04.2003 the decree holder bank filed the certified copy of the decree and also the vakalatnama of the respondent bank and hence the exe­cution case having been filed long after two and half years is hopelessly barred by limitation and as such are liable to be rejected as per provisions of Section 28 of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Nasir Ho ssain Chakladar vs. Joint District Judge (Md. Abdul Matin <span style="letter-spacing: 1.5pt;">J)</span> (Civil)6 ADC 302</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Section 12(2), 57</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="Style3" style="margin-top: 2.15pt; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Artha Rin Case rejecting the application filed under Sections 12(2) and 57 of the </span><span class="FontStyle13"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;">Section 13(1) of the Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003 of passing the judgment and decree on the basis of the admission of the defendant petitioner in his written statement, was allowed. </span></span><span class="FontStyle12"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;">Md. Kama] Uddin Akand vs Artha Rin Adalat </span></span><span class="FontStyle12"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: 1.5pt;">(Md. </span></span><span class="FontStyle12"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;">Tafazzul Islam J) (Civil) 383</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Artha Rin Adalat Ain, 2003 praying for adjustment of the outstanding loan with the sale price of the pledged goods and thereby to fix the actual claim amount in the suit. <em>M/S. United Leather Inter­national vs. Artha Rin Adalat (Shah Abu Nayeem Mominur Rahman J) (Civil) 6 ADC 978</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 5.05pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">Section 9</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.4pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast; letter-spacing: .5pt;">For realization of Tk.75,34,909.64/- by selling the mortgaged property de­scribed in the plaint. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-fareast;">M/s. Aimon Elec­trical Industries Proprietor vs. Judge, Artha Rin Adalat (Md. Abdul Matin J) (Civil) 7 ADC 964</span></em></p></div></div>
76	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">The B.T. Act, 2001</h2>

0in;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">The B.T. Act, 2001, Section 35</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">With a view to achieve its object has set up a modern television station and in that view of the matter, its Managing Director filed an application to the writ respondent No. 1 for granting a No Ob­jection Certificate (NOC) for operating terrestrial satellite television in the UHF Band. Thereupon the petitioners applied to the Bangladesh Telecommunication and Regulatory Commission (BTRC) for licence for frequency in the UHF Brand but BTRC did not issue the re­quired licence. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Jamuna Television vs. Bangladesh represented (S.K. Sin ha J) (Civil) 8 ADC 141</span></em></p></div></div>
77	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">The Bangladesh Biman Corporation (Service) Regulations, 1979</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p><b>Citation:</b>  10 ADC 247</p><p><b>Subject:</b>  Bangladesh Biman Corporation </p><p><b>Delivery Date:</b>  2018-10-28</p><!DOCTYPE points:</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Whether the instant writ petition having been decided by the High Court Divi­sion relying upon the decision reported in 13 MLR (AD) 1, (decided on 03.09.2007) interpreting the scope of regulation 11A(2) of the Bangladesh Biman Corporation (Service) Regula­tions, 1979 and in deciding the said case this Division having not considered an earlier decision of this Division reported in 10 BLT (AD) 22 (decided on 22.05.2000) on the same regulation in which a contrary view has been taken, the matter is required to be finally de­cided by this Court. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Managing Director, Biman Bangladesh Airlines vs. Syed Khwaza Jonaid (Sved Mahmud Hossain J) (Civil) 10 ADC 247</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right: 4.8pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; 78	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">The Bangladesh Constitution,</h2>

SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Table Grid"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Placeholder Text"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="1" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="No Spacing"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="60" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Shading"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="61" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light List"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="62" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Grid"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="63" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 1"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="64" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 2"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="65" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 1"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="66" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 2"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="67" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 1"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 2"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="69" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 3"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="70" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Dark List"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="71" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Shading"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="72" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful List"/>  <w:LsdException Shading Accent 1"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="61" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light List Accent 1"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="62" <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="64" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 2 Accent 2"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="65" SemiHidden="false" text-autospace: none; margin: 4.3pt 0in .0001pt 20.4pt;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">The Bangladesh Constitution, Article 48 (3)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span
