Name="Medium Grid 3 Accent 3"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="70" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Dark List Accent 3"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="71" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Shading Accent 3"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="72" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful List Accent 3"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="73" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Grid Accent 3"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="60" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Shading Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="61" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light List Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="62" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Grid Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="63" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 1 Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="64" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 2 Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="65" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 1 Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="66" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 2 Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="67" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 1 Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 2 Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="69" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 3 Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="70" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Dark List Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="71" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Shading Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="72" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful List Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="73" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Grid Accent 4"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="60" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Shading Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="61" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light List Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="62" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Grid Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="63" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 1 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="64" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 2 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="65" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 1 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="66" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 2 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="67" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 1 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 2 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="69" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 3 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="70" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Dark List Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="71" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Shading Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">The learned Judges of the High Court Division upon hearing the parties by judgment and order dated 9th Decem­ber, 2009, made the rule nisi absolute and declared the impugned memo dated 11th November, 2008, appoint­ing the writ respondent No.5, as ad­ministrator of Faridpur District Minibus Owners Group as has been passed without any lawful authority and is of no legal effect. Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh vs. Md. Abdul Kavum Miah (S.K. Sinha J) (Civil) 7 ADC 304</span></em></p></div></div>
142	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">The Voluntary Social Welfare Agencies (Registration and Con­trol) Ordinance, 1961 </h2>

9</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">It appears that all the three courts, on proper consideration of the facts, cir­cumstances and evidence on record and also examining the relevant law held the concurrent view that none of the circumstances and conditions stated in section 9 of Voluntary Social Welfare Agencies (Registration and Control) Ordinance, 1961 was prevail­ing and in that circumstances the regis­tration authority had no power to dissolve the existing governing body of the samity and to form an ad-hoc com-</span></em> <em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">mittee and as such the formation of ad-hoc committee and the subsequent election of the governing body held by that ad-hoc committee and also the said elected governing body of the samity were all illegal and, therefore, all the activities of that ad-hoc committee and the elected committee were illegal. Ays ha Siddiqua vs. Ms. Fazilatunnesa (Nazmun Ara Sultana J) (Civil) 10 ADC 232</span></em></p></div></div>
143	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">The Wakf Ordinance 1962</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p><b>Citation:</b>  6 ADC 930, 8 ADC 617, 10 ADC 222, 8 ADC 106, 7 ADC 474, 7 ADC 184</p><p><b>Subject:</b>   Wakf </p><p><b>Delivery Date:</b>  2018-11-12</p><!DOCTYPE html><p><!-- [if gte mso 9]><xml> <o:OfficeDocumentSettings>  <o:RelyOnVML/>  <o:AllowPNG/> </o:OfficeDocumentSettings></xml><![endif]--><!-- [if gte mso 9]><xml> UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Book Title"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="37" Name="Bibliography"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" QFormat="true" Name="TOC Heading"/> </w:LatentStyles></xml><![endif]--><!-- [if gte mso 10]><style> /* Style Definitions */ table.MsoNormalTable	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;	mso-style-noshow:yes;	mso-style-priority:99;	mso-style-qformat:yes;	mso-style-parent:"";	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;	mso-para-margin:0in;	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;	font-size:11.0pt;	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";	mso-ascii-font-family:Calibri;	mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";	mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;	mso-hansi-font-family:Calibri;	mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";	mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-bidi;}</style><![endif]--></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;">The Wakf Ordinance 1962</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">Which was earlier initiated on the basis of complaint made by the beneficiaries due to the mismanagement of the wakf estate by the respondent No. 9 was reaching its finality and the petitioner took certain steps to save the wakf es­tate and he was remarked. Administra­tor of waqfs vs. Shah Mohammad Alinoor (Md. Tafazzul Islam J)(Civil) 6 ADC 930 the newly appointed mutawalli as man­dated <strong>Section 32</strong></span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">From the judgment of the High Court Division it appears that the High Court Division made the Rule absolute mainly on the ground that the appeal filed before the District Judge which was heard and disposed of by the learned Additional District Judge was incompetent, as the removed mu-tawalli, that is, the present petitioner did not make over charge of waqf to</span></em> <em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">in sub-section (2) of section 32 of the Waqf Ordinance, 1962 (the Ordi­nance). Khurshed Alam vs. Ahul Kalam (Md. Abdul Wahhab Miah J) (Civil) 8 ADC 617</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;">Section 35 and 50</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">The grounds on which leave was granted can be decided by reference to the deed of waqf. In the schedule to the deed of waqf, there are so many plots including the plot No.608 and 610 but plot No.609 is conspicuously absent. The waqif enlisted the land of the deed of waqf in E. C.No.2323 which did not contain the disputed land. Even if, the land was shown to have been recorded as waqf in R. S., S. A. and Bangladesh records, those records or actions of the beneficiaries would have no legal ef­fect. Mr. Yusuf Chowdhury vs. Admin­istrator of Waqf (Syed Mahmud Hossain J) (Civil) 10 ADC 222</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;">Section 47</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">An application under section 47 of the Waqf ordinance, 1962 for enrolment of the disputed properties as Waqf prop­erty which was said to have registered under diary No.6862/605 dated 16th October, 1979. Shah Ahmed vs. Muhammad Abdullah (S.K. Sinha J) (Civil) 8 ADC 106</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;">Section 32(1)</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">Rejecting an application under Section</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">32(1) of the petitioner<span style="mso-tab-count: 1;">          </span>(1)</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">Petitioner's predecessor Tofazzal Ali Chowdhury created "Tofazzal Ali Chowdhury Waqf Estate" by deed No.415 dated 22.01.1915 with the noble and pious object of proper man­agement of two mosques and to meet the expenses for jiarat of the graveyard of the Wakif, his wife and his predeces­sors etc. Md. Yusuf Chowdhury vs. The Administration of Waqf' (Md. Abdul Matin J) (Civil) 7 ADC 474</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;">Section 32(2)</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">Respondent No.l who has been ap­pointed as joint mutwalli of the Waqf Estate along with the petitioner is func­tioning as joint mutwalli as such the question of handing over charge as pro­vided under Section 32(2) of the Waqf Ordinance does not arise and the appeal preferred by the petitioner was main­tainable in law. But the High Court Di­vision failed to consider the same which resulted in an error in the deci­sion and is liable to be set aside. Md. En am Ho s sain vs. Kayesh Mi ah (Md. Abdul Matin J) (Civil) 7 ADC 184</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p></div></div>
144	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">Town Improvement Act 1953</h2>

mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Town Improvement Act 1953 Section, 73</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 73 of Act 1953 authorizes RAJ UK to prepare a Master Plan for the area within its jurisdiction indicat­ing the manner in which it proposes that lands should be used. Once the Master Plan comes into force it be­comes unlawful for any person to use any land for any purposes other than that laid down in the Master Plan un­less he has been authorised to do so under section 75 of the Act. Any derogatory use of lands identified in the Master Plan shall need prior ap­proval as per provisions of Acts, 1953 and 2000.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></p></div></div>
145	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">Trad Marks Act, 1940</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p><b>Citation:</b>  6 ADC 819, 7 ADC 320, 6 ADC 105</p><p><b>Subject:</b>  Trad Marks</p><p><b>Delivery Date:</b>  2018-11-12</p><!DOCTYPE text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;">Trad Marks Act, 1940</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;"> </span></em></strong></p><p class="Style3" style="line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">To protect and safeguard the plaintiffs right, interests and title in Playing Cards which are extensively used by the plaintiff, the plaintiff have applied</span></em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> AND "VISA" in artistic style along with dis­tinctive colour scheme, design, device and getup under the statutory provision of Trade Marks Act, 1940 in the office of the Directorate of Patents, Designs and Trade Marks, Dhaka being Trade Mark No. 99825, 99826, 99827 and 99828 in class 16 all dated 13.6.2006. </span><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif';">Md. Ripon, Proprietor vs. Heze Wanda Plaving Cards Co. Ltd. (Md. Abdul Aziz J)(Civil) 6 ADC 819</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;">Section 46, 10(1), 8(a)</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">Trade Mark Application No. 13 of 2002 filed by the respondent No.l under Section 46 of the Trade Marks Act, 1940, allowing the application and making the Rule absolute and directing the registered Trade Mark No.21508 dated 18.12.1984 in Class-30 to be var­ied by way of deletion or omission of the words "NABICO/c^fet" both Eng­lish and Bangla. Baby Food Products Ltd. vs. Nabisco Biscuit &amp; Bread Fac­tory (Md. Abdul Matin J) (Civil) 7 ADC 320</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: .7pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Section 6(1) (d), 46(2)</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="Style3" style="margin-top: 2.4pt;"><span class="FontStyle13"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;">Application under section 46 of the Trade Marks Act, 1940 for rectification of the Register of Trade Marks by re­moving the registered Trade Marks .</span></span> <em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">M/S Yellow Pages (Pvt.) Ltd vs. M/S Business Data Information Ltd. (M.M. RhhulAmin CJ)(Civil)  6 ADC i05</span></em></p><p class="Style3" style="margin-top: 2.4pt; line-height: 14.15pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><span class="FontStyle13"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></span></p></div></div>
146	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">Transfer of Property Act, 1982</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p><b>Citation:</b>  8 ADC 1005, 7 ADC 557, 7 ADC 674, 6 ADC 459,  6ADC569, 6 ADC 794</p><p><b>Subject:</b>  Transfer of Property </p><p><b>Delivery Date:</b>  2018-11-12</p><!DOCTYPE html><p><!-- [if gte mso 9]><xml> <o:OfficeDocumentSettings>  <o:RelyOnVML/>  <o:AllowPNG/> </o:OfficeDocumentSettings></xml><![endif]--><!-- [if Heading"/> </w:LatentStyles></xml><![endif]--><!-- [if gte mso 10]><style> /* Style Definitions */ table.MsoNormalTable	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;	mso-style-noshow:yes;	mso-style-priority:99;	mso-style-qformat:yes;	mso-style-parent:"";	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;	mso-para-margin:0in;	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;	font-size:11.0pt;	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";	mso-ascii-font-family:Calibri;	mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";	mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;	mso-hansi-font-family:Calibri;	mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";	mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-bidi;}</style><![endif]--></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Transfer of Property Act, 1982</span></strong> Section 52</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">The petitioners' predecessor, Mohiud-din Khaled as plaintiff filed Title Suit No. 105 of 2001 in the Court of Joint District Judge and Commercial Court No.2, Dhaka for partition. After the death of Mohiuddin Khaled, the peti­tioners were substituted in the suit. The present respondent Nos.l and 2 (hereinafter referred to as the appli­cants) filed an application in the suit under Order I, rule 10(2)(4) of the</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">Code of Civil Procedure for adding them as defendants claiming that they purchased the suit land from one AT. <span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"> </span>Sanowar Kader, the rightful owner by two registered kabalas being Nos.2997 and 4436 dated 06.08.1997 and 29.10.2000 respectively. The learned Joint District Judge by his order dated 21.09.2002 rejected the prayer on the ground that the applicants purchased the property during the pendency of the suit. Although the doctrine of Lis pendens has not been mentioned in the order passed by the learned Joint Dis­trict Judge, in the back of his mind the said doctrine worked as it appears from a reading of the order rejecting the application. Challenging the said order of rejection of the prayer for ad­dition of party the applicants filed Civil Revision No.6576 of 2002 be­fore the High Court Division. A Divi­sion Bench of the High Court Division which heard the revision by the im­pugned judgment and order made the Rule absolute adding the applicants as defendants in the suit, hence this peti­tion for leave to appeal. Mohiuddin Khaled vs. Md. Ismail Hossain (Md. Abdul Wahhab Miah J) (Civil) 8 ADC 1005</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;"> </span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;">Section 31, 42A</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="Style3" style="mso-pagination: widow-orphan;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">Making the Rule absolute in part di­recting to prepare the record of right of the case property in the name of the original owner and record the names of</span></em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman','serif'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">the writ petitioner respondents as forcible possessors in the remark col­umn. <em>Mst. Komla Begum vs. Md. Sha-hab Ali (Md. Abdul Matin J) (Civil) 7 ADC 557</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 4.55pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Section 42A</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 2.65pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 14.4pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Making the Rule absolute in part di­recting to prepare the record of right of the case property in the name of the original owner and record the names of the writ petitioner respondents as forcible possessors in the remark col­umn. <em>Mst. Komla Begum vs. Md. Sha-hab Ali (Md. Abdul Matin J)(Civil) 7 ADC 674</em></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 17.75pt; text-align: center; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 17.75pt; text-align: center; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center; line-height: 14.4pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 4.55pt 0in .0001pt 17.75pt;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';">Transfer of Property Act, 1982 Section 106</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS';"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">The learned Judges of the High Court Division made the Rule absolute on discussion and proper consideration of the facts and law involved in the case holding that a registered deed of lease of immovable property for 99 years could only be determined by service of a notice under Section 106 of the Transfer of Property Act, 1982 and such a lease deed can not be cancelled in part and that partial cancellation of the lease deed by the respondent No.7 for non construction of any building in the portion of the petitioners land is not justified and warranted either by the lease deed or by law. <em>Dr. M.A. Yahia vs Md. Abdul Quader (Md. Abdul Aziz J) (Civil) 6 ADC 459</em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 106</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">The High Court Division held that the opposite parties in the revisional appli­cation have no possession in the ground floor as the opposite parties to the revisional application failed to show a single scrap of paper regarding their claim. Nazmul Huda Chowdhury vs. Janata Bank (M. M. Ruhul Amin CJ) (Civil) 6ADC569</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Section 43</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; letter-spacing: .5pt;">Salamatullah was a monthly tenant in respect of a shop in the building under Bazlus Sobhan a lawyer of Feni. For arrears of rent Bazlus Sobhan filed Title Suit No. 130 of 1980 in the 2nd Court of Munsif (now assistant Judge), Feni for ejectment of Salamatullah Ma-jumder. Zohiruddin Majumdar vs. Salamatullah being (M. M. Ruhul Amin J)(Civil) 6 ADC 794</span></em></p></div></div>
147	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">Zilla Parishad Ain, 2000</h2>

Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="61" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light List Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="62" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Grid Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="63" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 1 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="64" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 2 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="65" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 1 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="66" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 2 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="67" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 1 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 2 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="69" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 3 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="70" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Dark List Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="71" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Shading Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="72" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful List Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="73" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Grid Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="60" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Shading Accent 6"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="61" Roman";	mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-bidi;}</style><![endif]--></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt;">Zilla Parishad Ain, 2000, Section 39</span></em></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">Petitioner was originally appointed as a typist that while working as the Ad­ministrative Officer of Dhaka Zilla</span></em> <em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">Parishad petitioner was transferred to Rajshahi Zilla Parishad. This order of transfer was challenged in the writ pe­tition. Md. Siddiqur Rahman vs. Gov­ernment of Bangladesh (A.B.M. Khairul Haque J) (Civil) 7 ADC 653</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">The writ-petitioners were not selected in interview for appointment in their respective job, however, the committee recommended the matter to be placed before the syndicate for final decision. Accordingly, the matter was placed be­fore the 35th meeting of the syndicate of the University held on 01.11.2008 and the syndicate by its resolution No.26, extended the ad-hoc period of the writ-petitioners' services purely on humanitarian ground upto 31.12.2008 with the condition that under any cir­cumstances no further extension will be given and the ad-hoc appointment shall be deemed to be cancelled with the expiry of 31.12.2008 and that the aforesaid decision has been communi­cated to the writ-petitioners vide office order dated 20.11.2008 which has been impugned in the writ petition. The services of other 75 employees who have been confirmed were found fit in the interview. The Vice-Chancellor vs. Asia Rahman Shova (Mohammad Fa-zlul Karim J)(Civil) 7 ADC 1008.</span></em></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 12.0pt; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><em><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; letter-spacing: -.5pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;"> </span></em></p></div></div>
